short_summary: An advanced contract award notice for the accreditation of Correctional Service of Canada Health Services. The contract is for a period of five years and seven months with an option to extend for two additional one-year periods.
description: The Correctional Service Canada (CSC) Health Services has a requirement to maintain its accreditation status to remain in compliance with its legislated mandate. The CSC has a requirement for an external accreditation team to conduct an accreditation survey of the CSC Health Services delivery. The survey will cover the areas of leadership, infection prevention and control, medication management, CSC Health Services standards, mental health services, community-based mental health services and supports, and diagnostic imaging. The contractor will be required to provide ongoing support and coordination to the CSC Health Services throughout the accreditation process. The contract is for a period of five years and seven months with an option to extend for two additional one-year periods.
tags: International Society for Quality in Health Care
full_summary:
Dear valued contractors, 
The Correctional Service of Canada (CSC), through the Competition Bureau, invites you to participate in the upcoming open call for a tender for accreditation services. This open call requires a supplier able to maintain the CSC’s accreditation status for its health services institution.
Key Requirements:

* The supplier must have experience in the last 7 years in accrediting at least 10 health services organizations in Canada and have a proven track record of delivering accreditation services to complex healthcare settings.
* Supplier must have a team of at least 15 surveyors and two of them must be proficient in both official languages (English and French).
* Supplier must be experienced in conducting accreditation services in both official languages (English and French) and be able to perform at least two accreditations within this timeframe in both languages.
* Supplier must have possession of Relevant accreditation specialization headings.
 
The CSC’s health services institution requires a supplier that will aid in maintaining its accreditation status and provide ongoing support to ensuring continuous quality improvement. Accreditation will be conducted in accordance with professional standards of practice, which will strictly follow the relevant accreditation standards for quality in health care.  
Jane Doe
Competiton Bureau

Email: janesmith@competititonbureau.ca
